intro: Icacorea calvarioana, commonly known as the Calvarioana hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are large, heart-shaped, and have a velvety texture, contributing to its ornamental value.
